awd_titl_txt: Experimental Determination of the Pressure and Temperature  Dependence of the Distribution of Primitive Basaltic Liquid in Mantle Partial Melts
awd_abstract_narration: This proposal requested support for research on the nature of the               distribution of the liquid phase in partially molten materials                  representative of those occurring in the Earth's upper mantle.                  It is an experimental study of the wetting properties of                        basaltic melts of primitive composition as a function of                        temperature and pressure over ranges corresponding to accepted                  magma source regions.  The wetting angles are primary                           determinants of fluid distribution and permeability for fluid                   flow.  At the present time, wetting angle data are not available                over much of the pressure-temperature range commonly attributed                 to magma source regions within the mantle.  The information which               will be provided by this research is needed for proper                          understanding  of upper mantle magma segregation and transport                  processes operating in regions where primitive melt compositions                are generated.
